thread.title: Wake Forest's Miller-McIntyre to miss 4-6 weeks with foot fracture
thread.title_full: Wake Forest's Miller-McIntyre to miss 4-6 weeks with foot fracture

title: Wake Forest's Miller-McIntyre to miss 4-6 weeks with foot fracture
text:
Wake Forest's Miller-McIntyre to miss 4-6 weeks with foot fracture 
Posted 4:12 p.m. today Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * Are you human? * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters 
Winston-Salem, N.C. â€” Wake Forest senior guard Codi Miller-McIntyre underwent surgery on a fracture in his foot and will miss 4-to-6 weeks head coach Danny Manning announced Monday. The 6-foot-3 native of Concord, N.C., started all 32 games for the Demon Deacons in 2014-15, leading the team in scoring (14.5 ppg) and assists (137), while earning honorable mention All-ACC accolades. He is one of six ACC players to enter 2015-16 with over 1,000 career points (1,112). Miller-McIntyre has missed just two games during his first three seasons at Wake Forest. During his freshman season, he missed the game at NC State with strep throat. As a sophomore, he missed the game at Duke with an ankle injury. The Demon Deacons open the 2015-16 regular season on Nov. 13 as they host UMBC. Credits
